ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: What is the purpose of the study that was just described to you? Response: Two key concepts: (1) collect samples of DNA to (2) look at possible causes of emotional/thought problems (psychosis).
Notes: 0=Neither concept; 1=One concept, either (1) or (2); 2=Link both concepts (1) TO (2)

ElementDescription: What makes you want to consider participating in this study? Response: Two key concepts: (1) Increase people's knowledge about the human body and/or emotional/thought problems (psychosis) in order to (2) possibility make better treatments in the future.
Notes: 0=Neither concept OR Give my saliva or time for money OR Get treatment; 1=One concept; 2=Two concepts

ElementDescription: Do you believe this is primarily research or primarily treatment?
Notes: 0=Treatment OR I do not know OR both; 1=Research

ElementDescription: Do you have to be in this study?
If you withdraw from the study, will you still receive regular treatment?

If you participate in this study, what will you be asked to do? Response: Three tasks: (1) Allow researchers to look at my medical records; (2) Answer questions about my health; (3) Give a sample of my saliva.
Notes: 0=None of the above; 1=One task, either (1) or (2) or (3); 2=Two or more tasks

ElementDescription: Please describe some of the risks or discomforts that you may experience? Response: Three key concepts: (1) Answering questions about myself could be uncomfortable; (2) My personal information may be disclosed unintentionally; (3) We don't know how samples may be used in future genetic research.
Notes: 0=None of the above; 1=One concept, either (1) or (2) or (3); 2=Two or more concepts

ElementDescription: Please describe some of the possible benefits of this study. Response: (1) There are no direct benefits but indirect benefits include (2) helping humanity - increase knowledge about the human body and emotional/thought problems OR (3) possible improved treatments in the future.
Notes: 0=Neither concept OR I will be paid to participate; 1=One concept, either (1) or (2) or (3); 2=Two or more concepts

ElementDescription: Is it possible that being in this study will not have any benefit to you?
If you agree to be in this study, is it possible that your DNA and health information will be used for other research studies?
